description.en: The course introduces various approaches and methods used in landscape and climate change studies. The students practice the use of complex study and data analysis methods in physical geography.
description.et: Kursusel käsitletakse erinevateid lähenemisi ja meetodeid maastiku-uuringutes ning kliimamuutuse avaldumise ja selle loodusgeograafiliste mõjutuste analüüsil. Õpitakse loodusgeograafiliste kompleksuuringute ja kogutud andmestiku analüüsimise meetodeid praktilise tegevuse kaudu.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is introduce the mutual relations of various environmental elements and processes of landscape ecology, to give an overview of the contemporary problems an methods in physical geography and landscape ecology as well as skills to solve them.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärk on tutvustada erinevate keskkonnategurite vastastikust koosmõju ja maastikuökoloogilisi protsesse, anda ülevaade tänapäeva loodusgeograafia ja maastikuökoloogia peamistest probleemidest ja meetoditest ning oskused nende lahendamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: 1)	understand the development patterns of natural features and their mutual relations;
learning_outcomes.et: 1)	saab aru looduslike komponentide kujunemise seaduspärasustest ja nendevahelistest koostoimest;

learning_outcomes.en: 2)	know the terminology of physical geography and landscape ecology and is able explain the principles of the functions of main natural complexes;
learning_outcomes.et: 2)	valdab loodusgeograafia ja maastikuökoloogia terminoloogiat ja suudab lahti seletada peamiste looduslike komplekside toimimise põhimõtteid;

learning_outcomes.en: 3)	know the main flows of matter in natural landscapes on local, regional, and global scale;
learning_outcomes.et: 3)	tunneb peamisi ainevoogusid loodusmaastikus lokaalsel, regionaalsel ja globaalsel skaalal;

learning_outcomes.en: 4)	know the development of contemporary landscapes and is able to characterize regional units of landscape;
learning_outcomes.et: 4)	tunneb tänapäevaste maastike kujunemist ja arengutegureid ning oskab iseloomustatakse suuremaid regionaalseid maastikuüksusi;

learning_outcomes.en: 5)	know the causes and effects of global environmental changes;
learning_outcomes.et: 5)	teab globaalsete keskkonnamuutuste peamisi põhjuseid ja tagajärgi;

learning_outcomes.en: 6)	be acquainted with the main datasets of physical geography and be able to analyse these;
learning_outcomes.et: 6)	tunneb peamisi loodusgeograafilisi  andmestikke ja oskab neid analüüsida;

learning_outcomes.en: 7)	know the main methods of analysis in physical geography;
learning_outcomes.et: 7)	teab peamisi statistilisi andmeanalüüsi meetodeid loodusgeograafias;

learning_outcomes.en: 8)	know the evaluation methods of landscape structures and the methods of data analysis in this field.
learning_outcomes.et: 8)	teab maastiku struktuuri hindamise meetodeid ja selles valdkonnas kasutatavaid andmeanalüüsi meetodeid.

independent_work.et: Report (essay) based on at least 3 articles on various topics considering energy flows and biogeochemical cycles from local to global levels. Can be done also by a group of 2 members.

description.et: Examination gives 70% of the final result, the results of 3 tests 15%, and the seminar report 15%

grade_preconditions.et:
Originality, ability to use reading materials for particular empirical context, ability to understand various research methods for studying climatic and biogeochemical processes, ability of critical thinking and producing constructive creative ideas, technical competences.
Oral presentation of the report and submission of its written form.
In the case of group work, the contribution of both group members into the final report will be assessed. Both members are expected to have more or less equal contribution to the project (50:50%), as well as in the preparation of presentations during the seminars. The contributions of all team members can be assessed differently.

grade_evaluation.et: Examination gives 70% of the final result and the report 30%. Regarding the report, oral presentation, level of understanding the issue and technical realisation will be assessed.

debt_elimination.et: In agreement with the course leaders

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et: Energy fluxes: Climate processes I, Radiation balance (Prof. J. Jaagus)
Energy fluxes: Climate processes II, Atmospheric circulation (Prof. J.Jaagus)

Energy fluxes: Climate processes III, Urban climate (Prof. J. Jaagus)
Test I: Climate processes
Material cycling I: Carbon cycle and regulating processes (Prof. I. Ostonen-Märtin)
Material cycling II: Nitrogen cycle and regulating processes (Prof. Ü. Mander)
Material cycling III: Phosphorus & Sulfur cycling (Prof. Ü. Mander)

Material cycling IV: Environmental pollutants (Prof. Ü. Mander)
Test II: Material cycling
Ecological engineering for energy & material fluxes control I: Green infrastructure of landscape and settlements (Prof. Ü. Mander)
Ecological engineering for energy & material fluxes control II: Constructed wetlands   (assoc. professor Margit Kõiv-Vainik)

Seminar: presentation assignment reports (Prof. Ü. Mander, Prof. J. Jaagus,
Dr. I. Ostonen-Märtin, Dr. J. Pärn)
